title: How to Play: Your Turn
description:
When it's the turn of one of your pices, you will be asked for a command.
  The commands you can use are dependent upon the piece you are controlling.
 You can use a command by either clicking on the corresponding reaction or by typing the name of the command in all caps.
 Once you select a command, you  may need to specify a option later.  You select options either by typing in their name (case sensitive) or by using a reaction.

fields.name: MOVE
fields.value: Move to a new space on the board.  Requires Coordinates are in chessboard notation.

fields.name: SKILL
fields.value: Use a skill.  Uses the case sensitive names of the skills.

fields.name: DRAW
fields.value: Draw a card from your deck, and add it to your hand.

fields.name: FOCUS
fields.value: Add x1.5 of any mana type.

fields.name: SUMMON
fields.value: Summon a creature in your hand to a adjacent space.

fields.name: SPELL
fields.value: Use a spell card.  Not implimented yet.

fields.name: Local Commands
fields.value: There are some commands that are not shown.  They will be listed below.

fields.name: OVERVIEW
fields.value: Resend the current status messages.

fields.name: QUIT
fields.value: Forfiet the match and quit.

fields.name: CHAT
fields.value: send a chat message.  Not implimented yet.

fields.name: Protip
fields.value: The END command ends your turn.

fields.name: Protip 2
fields.value: You can do multiple commands by typing them in the same message separated by spaces.

title: How to Play: Turns and Rounds
description:
This game is divided up into **rounds.**  
 Each round is divided up into **turns.**

A **round** consists of every piece taking one **turn.**

The order of each turn is determined at the start of the round based on their **Speed** stat.

**Pieces** with a higher **speed** go first, pieces with a lower speed go **last.**

After a turn ends, the game will allow the next piece to do their **turn.**  When all turns have ended, the round will end.

fields.name: Round
fields.value: The unit by which the game's playtime is divided.  Every piece will have one turn during each round.

fields.name: Turn
fields.value: A piece's turn is when a piece can do something during each round.  After

fields.name: Speed
fields.value: The value by which the order of turns are determined.

title: How to play: Pieces.
description:
A piece refers to anything the board.  
Each piece has HP, SPEED, a Move Style, etc.

fields.name: HP
fields.value:
Health points.  This indicates how healthy a piece is.  When HP reaches zero, they will be unable to do anything on their turn.
When each round ends, any piece with 0 HP will perish, and will be removed from the board.
If you leader's HP is zero at the end of a round, you will lose the game.

fields.name: Speed
fields.value: This stat determines the turn order of a creature.  For example, if one piece had a **speed** of 45 and *another piece* has a **speed** of 34, the piece with the speed of 45 will go first.

fields.name: Reading move style.
fields.value:
`⬜⬜🟦⬜⬜`       `🟩`= the piece's current position.
`⬜🟦🟦🟦⬜`       `🟦`= can walk to this space if there is nothing in the way.
`🟦🟦🟩🟦🟦`       `🟥`= can move in STRAIGHT LINE this way, if nothing is in the way.
`⬜🟦🟦🟦⬜`       `🟨`= can hop to this space, as long as nothing is in that space. 
`⬜⬜🟦⬜⬜`                     (Think a knight.)
The game will show you all the possible spots a piece can move to when you use the MOVE action.  Don't worry about calculating this.

title: How To Play: Leaders
description: The leader piece is a extension of you, the player.  It's the most important piece in the game.

fields.name: During Turn
fields.value: During your leader's turn, you can preform the following actions.

fields.name: MOVE
fields.value: MOVE to any adjacent space one time.

fields.name: DRAW
fields.value: Draw one card from your deck and add it to your hand.

fields.name: FOCUS
fields.value: Add 1.5 of any summon point.

fields.name: SUMMON
fields.value:
Summon a creature from hand to a space on the board 1 square away from this piece.
**Notice: ends turn.**

fields.name: SPELL
fields.value: Use a spell card.  Not implemented yet.

fields.name: Note
fields.value: TBD

fields.name: Protip.
fields.value: If your Leader's HP is zero at the end of a round, you lose the game.  If you can somehow heal your leader before this, well... do it.

title: How to Play: Creatures
description: If the Leader is the king, the Creature is the pawn.

fields.name: During Turn
fields.value: During a creature's turn, they can preform the following actions.

fields.name: MOVE
fields.value: Move according to the move style.

fields.name: SKILL
fields.value: Preform a skill.  See next page.

fields.name: Protip.
fields.value: If a **Creature's** HP is zero at the end of a round, they will be removed from the board, and the card used to summon them will be sent to their player's **graveyard.**

title: How to play: Skills
description: Skills are the actions that can be performed by a creature.  Each creature typically has 1-3 skills, but each skill varies in what they do.

fields.name: Trigger
fields.value: How the skill is activated.

fields.name: **command**
fields.value: - Skill must be activated by the player.

fields.name: **auto**
fields.value: - Skill is used at the start of a turn.

fields.name: Limit
fields.value: What limits the skill's activation. More TBD

fields.name: Type
fields.value:
• Attack-`This skill will do some kind of damage to a piece.`
   ‣ Ailment- `Inflicts a negative ailment on the target`
   • Support- `This skill will have some positive effect for the target.` 
   ‣ Buff- `Augments some value on the card.`
  `More Types will be added as the game evolves.`

fields.name: Target
fields.value:
What the skill will impact.  split into `Target Range`, `Target Scope`, `Target Amount`, and `Target Restrictions.`
See next page.

title: How To Play: Targeting
description:
A **target** is defined as anything a skill will impact.  
This is split into Target Range, Target Scope, Target Amount, and Target Restrictions.
**Range:** The shape the skill will impact, along with the number of squares expanding from the user that the skill will impact.
**Scope:** Which team the skill will impact.
**Amount:** The amount of pieces the skill will impact.
**Restrictions:** Sets by which the target is restricted. TBD.

fields.name: Range
fields.value: The shape the skill will impact, along with the number of squares expanding from the user that the skill will impact.

fields.name: Cardinal
fields.value:
"Like a Rook.
A Space to the immediate North, South, East, Or West.  No diagonals.
"

fields.name: Diagonal
fields.value:
"Like a Bishop.
Any square diagonal to the current position."

fields.name: Omni
fields.value:
"Like a Queen.
Any space that is perpindicular or diagonal to the user."

fields.name: Adjacent
fields.value:
"A space immedately  next to the user."
**This**
Only impacts whatever is on the user's space.
**Other**
When the board doesn't matter.

fields.name: Row
fields.value:
"Anything in the same Row."
**Column**
"Anything in the same Column."
**Any**
"Anywhere on the board."

fields.name: Scope
fields.value:
**Enemy** 
Impact the enemy team.
**Ally**
 Impact your own team.
**Both**
 It doesn't matter, impact everyone and everything regardless of team.
**Self**
 Impact yourself.
**Else** 
Impact something else entirely.

fields.name: Restrictions.
fields.value:
How the target is restricted.  Usually impacts the spaces.
`NOSELF` - will never target user.
`ONEWAY`- use in only one direction.

fields.name: Protip
fields.value: You don't have to specify a target if the number of pieces covered by shape is less than the value specified in amount.

fields.name: Hand
fields.value: A list of cards you have access to at the current moment.  This is only visible to you and you alone.

fields.name: Deck
fields.value: All cards currently in your deck.  You can move cards to your hand by using the DRAW command.

fields.name: Graveyard
fields.value: All Cards that you own that have been removed from play.

fields.name: Summon Points/ Mana.
fields.value:
Resource required to put cards into play.  In order to summon, you need a combinaiton of `🔴Red`, `🔵Blue`, and `🟢Green` Summon points.  Comes in 4 color coded flavors, and is generated before each turn..
   • `🔴Red` Mana- First Type.  Also called `🍎 Apple` flavored.
   • `🔵Blue` Mana- Second Type.  Also called  `🍇Berry` flavored.
   • `🟢Green` Mana- Third Type.  Also called `🍈 Melon` flavored.
   • `⚪ Universal` Mana- A Universal Type, can be used to substitute any flavor.

fields.name: Protip.
fields.value: You gain mana each time it's your leader's turn.
